intro: Psychotria trujilloi var. yaracuyensis, commonly known as the Yaracuyensis Psychotria, is a species native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
